body:
@runzhiwang working well thanks. Your patch solve our issue between spark-magic and livy.
During our stress test we found another one I think link to this bug.

Kerberos handshake are in 2 phase : client send a first request, server respond 401 asking for the kerberos ticket then client send his kerberos ticket, server respond 200 or 201.

Then issue is : 
 1) client 1 send a  request, server respond 401.
 2) During the response, client 2 send also a  request, server respond 401.
 3) Client 1 send his kerberos ticket, it get denied by the server waiting for the client 2 kerberos ticket not the client 1
 4) Client 2 send his kerberos ticket, server respond 200

The log from request log

```
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:49 +0000] "GET https://url:8999/sessions/628/statements/8 HTTP/1.1" 401 356
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:49 +0000] "GET https://url:8999/sessions/628/statements/8 HTTP/1.1" 200 177
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:51 +0000] "POST https://url:8999/sessions/630/statements HTTP/1.1" 401 354
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:51 +0000] "POST https://url:8999/sessions/629/statements HTTP/1.1" 401 354
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:51 +0000] "POST https://url:8999/sessions/629/statements HTTP/1.1" 201 102
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:52 +0000] "GET https://url:8999/sessions/629/statements/4 HTTP/1.1" 401 356
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:52 +0000] "GET https://url:8999/sessions/629/statements/4 HTTP/1.1" 200 177
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:54 +0000] "POST https://url:8999/sessions/628/statements HTTP/1.1" 401 354
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:54 +0000] "POST https://url:8999/sessions/628/statements HTTP/1.1" 201 101
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:55 +0000] "GET https://url:8999/sessions/628/statements/9 HTTP/1.1" 401 356
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:55 +0000] "GET https://url:8999/sessions/628/statements/9 HTTP/1.1" 200 177
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:56 +0000] "POST https://url:8999/sessions/630/statements HTTP/1.1" 401 354
ip - - [23/Dec/2019:15:06:56 +0000] "POST https://url:8999/sessions/630/statements HTTP/1.1" 201 99
```

Do you think, it's link ?
@tprelle Do your client1 and client2 connect to the same driver ? It lookes like client1 and client2 belong to different session, if so, they does not connect to the same driver, and it's not link.

@runzhiwang same livy but not the same session so not the same driver. 

ok thanks
@tprelle Hi, Could you explain why this patch solve your issue between spark-magic and livy?

@runzhiwang We are using spark-magic inside jupyterhub, using just one livy
Without your patch,  if two users on the same host use two differents notebook in parallel it's working well. But when the same user  on the same host use more than one notebook (so same user but one unique session by notebook) in parallel. One notebook is working well other get 'Error 500 RPC channel will close'. 

With your patch same user can use notebook in parallel. 
Maybe your patch fix more than you think ?
@tprelle Okay, I see. Thank you very much.
Is there any progress :)
@kangtiann seems to be frozen, I'm preparing post for the mailing lists to attract more attention to it. Hope that in the beginning of 2020 to see the progress)
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LIVY-138

Hi fenimore,

VCL-1018 is related to the Apache VCL project rather than the Apache Incubator Livy project. If you want your pull request to be associated with a JIRA issue, you'll need to find one associated with Livy.  I work on the VCL project and am not familiar with the Livy project. So, I don't know if they use JIRA to track issues or not.

-Josh

Hi ,

Sorry for the late reply.

We are successful in integrating livy with kubernetes using the build you
have provided.Thanks for the support.

Thanks,
Harish

> > using native methods prevent to create new process
> 
> @Jassy1994 would you please explain more about this? I was thinking should it be the behavior of Hadoop, not Livy, why do we need to be aware of this in Livy side?

@jerryshao 
I find Livy FileSystemStateStore use RawLocalFileSystem when store recoveryMetadata in local. RawLocalFileSystem default use deprecated file status which won't call hadoop native libs, so we need call this static method explicitly to forbid using deprecated file status. of course this issue has relation about hadoop and hadoop native libs should be supplied and can be quoted by livy server.

Livy HA with redirection:

In this pull request we are adding Active/Standby High Availability (HA) to Livy Server. The goal of HA is to ensure that amoung a group of Livy Servers, only 1 is Active at 
any given time while the others are on Standby. Our changes are as following:

Leveraging Zookeeper to handle Leader Election:
In order to achieve HA, we need a service to handle keeping track of the current leader. To do this, we created a CuratorElectorService class which will register the Livy Server 
instance into the Leader election group and keep track of the leader. This class leverages the Apache Curator LeaderLatch Library to keep track of the current leader. 
This class is also responsible for restarting the Livy Webserver when it transitions from Standby state to Active. This restart is where the Livy Webserver performs session recovery.



Redirecting to the active webserver:
With the CuratorElectorService class, Livy Server can now determine whether it is Active or on Standby. If it is active, it proceeds as usual. However, if it is on standby, it will
use the configuration in livy.conf to determine the endpoint to redirect the request to.


Creating configurations to enable HA:
We added user configurations to enable HA. These include specifying whether or not HA is enabled, the endpoints of the Livy Server instances used for HA, and the zookeeper instances 
used for leader election.



Splitting Livy's start() function to init() and start():
Currently, Livy's start() function is overloaded to both initalize all of its components (the webserver, its servlets, and session managers) and then safely start them. This PR
separates the start() function into an init() component and a start() components. This is to allow us to restart the session managers and trigger session recovery without having
to safely tear down and rebuild the Livy Webserver every time. 

@jerryshao can I get some eyes for a code review/suggestions?

I adopted Imran's suggestion for rewriting `incrementConnections`.
I also added a test case for multiple connection limits being violated; the error message is for the first limit that we check.
I am passing on additional nice-to-have tests. There is always room for improvement for the tests. This can be an area for further contributions, possibly from new contributors!
